prompt.name: Search for a Specific Technology
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User searches for a specific technology and verifies the search results page.

input.action: 'Click on the search bar in the main navigation', 'Enter `JavaScript` into the searchbar','Press Enter', 'Verify that the search results page is displayed with relevant articles.'

expected.outcome: The search results page for 'JavaScript' is displayed, showing a list of articles related to JavaScript.

prompt.name: Navigate to References Section
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the 'References' section from the main menu.

input.action: 'Click on the `References` link in the main navigation menu', 'Verify that the page title is `Web technology for developers`'

expected.outcome: The 'References' page is displayed, showing different web technologies.

prompt.name: Change Website Theme
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User changes the website's theme from light to dark mode.

input.action: 'Click on the `Theme` button in the main navigation', 'Select `Dark` from the dropdown menu', 'Verify that the website background color changes to a dark color'

expected.outcome: The website's theme is successfully changed to dark mode.

prompt.name: Navigate to HTML Reference Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the HTML reference page using the main navigation.

input.action: 'Click on the `References` link in the main navigation', 'Scroll down to the `Web technology references` section', 'Click on the `HTML` link in the `Web technology references` section', 'Verify the page title is `HTML: HyperText Markup Language`'

expected.outcome: The HTML reference page is displayed.

prompt.name: Check Tools Dropdown Menu
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User checks the 'Tools' dropdown menu for available tools.

input.action: 'Click on the `Tools` link in the main navigation', 'Verify that a dropdown menu with `Playground`, `HTTP Observatory` and `AI Help` appears'

expected.outcome: The 'Tools' dropdown menu is displayed with a list of available tools.

prompt.name: Explore the About Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the 'About' page to learn more about MDN.

input.action: 'Scroll to the bottom of the page', 'Click on the `About` link in the footer', 'Verify the page title is `About MDN`'

expected.outcome: The 'About MDN' page is displayed.

prompt.name: Use Search with a Typo
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User searches with a typo and checks for 'Did you mean' suggestions.

input.action: 'Click on the search bar in the main navigation', 'Enter `JavsScript` into the searchbar','Press Enter', 'Verify that a `Did you mean...` suggestion is displayed'

expected.outcome: A search suggestion is provided for the misspelled query.

prompt.name: Navigate to the Learn Area
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the 'Learn web development' area.

input.action: 'Click on the `Learn` link in the main navigation', 'Verify the page title is `Learn web development`'

expected.outcome: The main 'Learn' page is displayed with different learning topics.

prompt.name: Find Web APIs Reference
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User finds the 'Web APIs' reference from the 'References' section.

input.action: 'Click on the `References` link in the main navigation', 'Scroll down to the `Web technology references` section', 'Click on the `Web APIs` link in the `Web technology references` section', 'Verify the page title is `Web APIs`'

expected.outcome: The 'Web APIs' reference page is displayed.

prompt.name: Check for CSS Reference Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the CSS reference page.

input.action: 'Click on the `References` link in the main navigation', 'Scroll down to the `Web technology references` section', 'Click on the `CSS` link in the `Web technology references` section', 'Verify the page title is `CSS: Cascading Style Sheets`'

expected.outcome: The CSS reference page is displayed.

prompt.name: Navigate to JavaScript Reference Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the JavaScript reference page.

input.action: 'Click on the `References` link in the main navigation', 'Scroll down to the `Web technology references` section', 'Click on the `JavaScript` link in the `Web technology references` section', 'Verify the page title is `JavaScript`'

expected.outcome: The JavaScript reference page is displayed.

prompt.name: Navigate to HTTP Reference Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the HTTP reference page.

input.action: 'Click on the `References` link in the main navigation', 'Scroll down to the `Web technology references` section', 'Click on the `HTTP` link in the `Web technology references` section', 'Verify the page title is `HTTP: Hypertext Transfer Protocol`'

expected.outcome: The HTTP reference page is displayed.

prompt.name: Go to MDN Plus Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the 'MDN Plus' page.

input.action: 'Click on the `Plus` link in the main navigation', 'Verify the page title is `More MDN. Your MDN.`'

expected.outcome: The MDN Plus page is displayed.

prompt.name: Navigate to the Blog
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the MDN blog.

input.action: 'Click on the `Blog` link in the main navigation', 'Verify the page title contains `Blog`'

expected.outcome: The MDN blog page is displayed, showing the latest articles.

prompt.name: Learning Workflow: JavaScript Basics
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A new user wants to learn JavaScript basics by navigating through the 'Learn' area.

action: Hover over `Learn` in the main navigation
Click on the `JavaScript` card from the dropdown menu
Scroll down to the `Tutorials and challenges` section
Click on the `What is JavaScript?` article link
Verify the article title is `What is JavaScript?`
Scroll down to the `Summary` section
Click on the `Next` button below the `Summary` section
Verify the new article title is `A first splash into JavaScript`

expected.outcome: User successfully navigates through the initial JavaScript learning modules.

prompt.name: Finding and Exploring a Web API
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A developer wants to find information about the 'Fetch API' and explore its examples.

action: Click on the search bar in the main navigation
In the search bar, type `Fetch API` and press Enter
Verify the page title is `Fetch API`
Scroll down and click on the `Using the Fetch API` link in the left-hand side navigation
Verify the new page title is `Using the Fetch API`

expected.outcome: Developer successfully finds the 'Fetch API' documentation and navigates to its examples and related guides.

prompt.name: Interactive Example Workflow
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user interacts with a live code example for a JavaScript array method.

action: Click on the search bar in the main navigation
In the search bar, type `Array.prototype.map()` and press Enter
Click on the `Array.prototype.map()` link from the search results
Scroll down to the `Try it` interactive example
Click the `Run` button
Verify the output `[2, 8, 18, 32]` is displayed
In the code editor, change `x * 2` to `x * 3`
Click the `Run` button again
Verify the new output `[3, 12, 27, 48]` is displayed

expected.outcome: User successfully runs, modifies, and re-runs an interactive code example.

prompt.name: Browser Compatibility Check Workflow
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A developer checks the browser compatibility for the 'CSS Grid Layout' feature.

action: Click on the search bar in the main navigation
In the search bar, type `CSS Grid Layout` and press Enter
Verify the page title is `CSS Grid Layout`
Scroll down to the `Reference` section on the main page
Click on the `grid-auto-columns` link
Verify the page title is `grid-auto-columns`
Scroll down to the `Browser compatibility` table
Verify the table is visible
In the table, find the `Chrome` column
Check the version number in this column
Verify the version is `57` or another plausible number

expected.outcome: Developer successfully finds and verifies browser compatibility information for a CSS feature.

prompt.name: Understanding an HTML Element and its Relatives
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user wants to understand the HTML `<canvas>` element and find related tutorials.

action: Click on the search bar in the main navigation
In the search bar, type `canvas element` and press Enter
Verify the page title is `<canvas>: The Graphics Canvas element`
Scroll down to the `See also` section
Click on the `Canvas tutorial` link
Verify the new page title is `Canvas tutorial`
Use the browser's back button to return to the `<canvas>` page
Verify the page title is `<canvas>: The Graphics Canvas element` again

expected.outcome: User successfully finds information on an HTML element and navigates to and from its related tutorials.

prompt.name: Navigating through the Web APIs Reference
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A developer navigates deep into the Web APIs reference to find a specific method.

action: Hover over `References` in the main navigation
Click on the `Web APIs` link
Scroll down to the `I` section
Click on the `Intersection Observer API` link
Verify the page title is `Intersection Observer API`
In the left-hand navigation under `Interfaces`, click on the `IntersectionObserver` link
Verify the page title is `IntersectionObserver`
In the left-hand navigation under `Instance methods`, click on the `observe()` link
Verify the page title is `IntersectionObserver: observe() method`
Scroll down to the `Syntax` section of the page
Verify the syntax `observe(targetElement)` is displayed

expected.outcome: Developer successfully navigates through the API reference to find a specific method and its syntax.

prompt.name: Exploring HTTP Headers
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A security engineer looks up the 'Content-Security-Policy' HTTP header.

action: Click on the search bar in the main navigation
In the search bar, type `Content-Security-Policy (CSP) header` and press Enter
Verify the page title is `Content-Security-Policy (CSP) header`
Scroll to the `Directives` section
Click on the `script-src` link in the `Directives section`
Verify the page title is `Content-Security-Policy: script-src directive`
Scroll down to the `Examples` section
Verify that code examples for the directive are present

expected.outcome: User successfully finds and explores the documentation for a specific HTTP header and its directives.

prompt.name: Using the Playground Tool
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user writes and executes code in the MDN Playground.

action: Click on the `Tools` link in the main navigation
Click on `Playground` from the dropdown menu
Verify the page title is `PLAYGROUND`

In the HTML pane, add `

Hello, World!

`
In the CSS pane, add `h1 { color: blue; }`
In the JS pane, add `console.log('Hello from JS!');`
Verify the text in the output pane is blue and says `Hello, World!`
Check the console output in the developer tools to see `Hello from JS!`

expected.outcome: User successfully creates a simple project in the Playground and sees the live output.

prompt.name: Finding a Glossary Definition
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user searches for the definition of a technical term in the MDN glossary.

action: Click on the search bar in the main navigation
In the search bar, type `glossary` and press Enter
Verify the page title is `Glossary of web terms`
On the left-hand side navigation, click on the `Filter` search bar
Type `Callback function` into the `Filter` search bar
Click on the `Callback function` link in the left-hand side navigation
Verify the page title is `Callback function`
Read the definition of a callback function
Verify the definition is present and readable

expected.outcome: User successfully navigates the glossary to find and read the definition of a specific term.

prompt.name: Navigating with Breadcrumbs
prompt.instruction: go to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user navigates deep into the documentation and uses breadcrumbs to go back.

action: Click on `References`
Scroll down to the `Web technology references` section
Click on `HTML`
Scroll down to the `Reference` section
Click on the `HTML element reference` link
Scroll down to the `Inline text semantics` section
Click on the `<a>` link in the table
Verify the page title is `<a>: The Anchor element`
At the top of the page, locate the breadcrumb trail
Click on the `HTML` breadcrumb link
Verify the page title is now `HTML: HyperText Markup Language`

expected.outcome: User successfully navigates deep into the site and uses breadcrumbs for upward navigation.
